solution_line_template: He bikes {distance_to_work}*{round_trip_multiplier}=<<{distance_to_work}*{round_trip_multiplier}={daily_work_miles}>>{daily_work_miles} miles each day for work
So he bikes {daily_work_miles}*{workdays_per_week}=<<{daily_work_miles}*{workdays_per_week}={weekly_work_miles}>>{weekly_work_miles} miles for work
That means he bikes a total of {weekly_work_miles}+{weekend_ride_miles}=<<{weekly_work_miles}+{weekend_ride_miles}={total_weekly_miles}>>{total_weekly_miles} miles for work
So he bikes a total of {total_weekly_miles}/{biking_speed_mph}=<<{total_weekly_miles}/{biking_speed_mph}={total_biking_hours}>>{total_biking_hours} hours
